attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Develop an Isle Of Wight Airport for potential Commercial Airline use
attributes.background:
The Isle Of Wight is in the unfortunate position of having very expensive and unreliable ferries as the only way to get to and from it at present.
This is why it really needs a developed airport to be served by Ryanair, Easyjet etc to give everyone another option to get to and from the Island.
attributes.additional_details:
The Channel Islands which are smaller and have fewer events and far fewer tourists have the option of flights or ferries.

The Isle Of Skye has a fixed link or ferries as options.
It really doesn't feel that the Isle Of Wight's population or visitors are given the support that the aforementioned Islands receive with regards to options of transport to and from the Island at a fair price. We are held to ransom by the ferry companies as that's the only option we have available to us.

attributes.action: Discuss the mental health issues in Calderdale after increase in suicides
attributes.background: Due to recent suicides there are clearly issues in Calderdale with mental health. This needs to be reviewed to stop more people from taking their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Whether this is to look at putting a net around the bridge or increasing funding and looking at waiting times in this area, the people of Halifax need to know something is been done! 
Please sign.

attributes.action: Offer tax relief on the fees for the EU Settlement Scheme
attributes.background: EU citizens who were not eligible to vote in the Brexit referendum are being charged £65 to apply to stay in the UK. This is manifestly unjust. As a bare minimum we should recognise the contribution of our friends & neighbours by offering income tax relief on these fees.

attributes.action: Make All Disabled Toilets Air Freshener Free - Some Disabilities are Invisible
attributes.background: Please support me in making disabled toilets accessible for those individuals with invisible disabilities or who may be allergic to air fresheners.  These are used in most public toilets including those in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally suffer from a form of Dysautonomia and have to wear a special mask when I use a public toilet, this can be uncomfortable and unfortunately often attracts unwanted attention.
I feel it is important to get recognition that having these electronic devices fitted in disabled toilets or using a can of air freshener in place of it, puts many people at risk. A risk that no one should have to take!

attributes.action: Remove the Sudanese Embassador from the UK
attributes.background: Killing protesters must stop. The Sudanese government is not responding to any call, therefore, an international deplomatic pressure must start immediately. We are asking for the removal of Sudanese embassador from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Sudan is currently experiencing a severe economic crisis which has led to a rise in the cost of fuel, electricity, transport, food and medicine provoking countrywide protests. Since 14 December, tens of thousands of people have been taking part in protests in different parts of the country. Security officers use lethal forces at protestors to disperse them killing 37 so far. The government has also shut down the internet since 20 December, in yet another attempt to stop the protests. (Amnesty)

attributes.action: A holder of a full UK driving licence can pay to remove minor penalty points
attributes.background: To submit a change in the law where a holder of a full uk driving licence can pay £100.00 per penalty point to remove minor diving penalty points from his/her licence after a period of 6 months from the offence with the proceeds going back in to road safety, education or transportation links.
attributes.additional_details: The Uk driving licence has not been reviewed since 1988 and since this time technology has moved on as well as the public travelling more and for longer distances which means a greater risk of accumulating points of a shorter period of time which will in turn creates financial hardship and damage to the economy for many who rely on motor vehicles in the UK, The money from this change can be used to be spent on road safety and education or better transportation links.

attributes.action: Stop HMRC from referring to the UK taxpayers as their "customers"
attributes.background: HMRC, in all their publications as well as communications to individuals refers to us, the body of the Great British tax payer as "customers". This is not only misleading, but an outright mockery given the absence of choice over who and what you as a "customer" deal with.
attributes.additional_details: A customer is an individual or business that purchases the goods or services produced by a business. Attracting customers is the primary goal of most public-facing businesses, because it is the customer who creates demand for goods and services." The UK taxpayer does not create a demand for HMRC, nor do we have a choice or any consumer rights when it comes to dealing with HMRC. Therefore, HMRC must revert to using the term "taxpayer" in all their publications and communications.

attributes.action: Introduce a Tax on and revoke VAT exemption for beef products
attributes.background:
Countless scientists have identified excessive beef consumption as both a major threat to our planet, and to our health. If we introduce a tax on beef products we could:

1) Decrease consumption
2) Raise money for schools and hospitals
3) Save the planet
attributes.additional_details: The specific amount for the tax should be debated in parliament, however a guideline would be 1p per gram of beef which would be charged to the retailer. This would be on top of the standard VAT rate.

attributes.action: Allow UK citizens abroad right to vote and UK residents a Referendum vote
attributes.background:
1 All UK citizens living abroad should be allowed to vote in any electoral & referendum vote, as any other civilised country allows. This is an undeniable citizenship right

2 Any UK resident should be allowed right to vote in any referendum, as is the case with commonwealth citizens and Maltese

attributes.action: Mandatory Regulation of Payroll Providers
attributes.background: Just as all other financial industries are regulated, the payroll industry should be regulated too. This industry becomes more complex each month requiring experts to carry out the function. The impact of a poorly run payroll on the economy, the employer and the employees is huge.
attributes.additional_details: Similar to The Pension's Regulator, there must now be a Payroll Regulator. Providers of any form of payroll, big or small, must be registered and comply with a standard set of rules with inspections and complaint investigations available.

attributes.action: Review animal cruelty laws to include lifetime ban and a prison sentence
attributes.background: A lifetime ban on animal/pet ownership should be introduced for severe cases of animal cruelty. Also, for severe cases of cruelty, longer prison sentences should be considered. The current laws should be harsher to deter owners of animals being cruel to their pets.
attributes.additional_details:
A very distressing case of a woman letting a horse starve, which eventually had to be put down, is just one of the latest examples. 
"starved her horse to the point of collapse which led to her eventual death". This story was highlighted on derbytelegraph.co.uk.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for online platforms to allow sales of CITES-protected species
attributes.background: While it's illegal to buy and sell seahorses (dead, alive, whole or in part) within Europe, online platforms flout this law by hosting adverts for their sale. Seahorses could therefore be functionally extinct in 25 - 30 years* (based on 150 million + seahorses per year taken from the sea).
attributes.additional_details:
Ref: * figures from SaveourSeahorses
 
The Seahorse Trust (www.theseahorsetrust.org) has campaigned and highlighted to each online marketplace over the last twelve + months the illegality of sales of CITES-protected seahorses, but is continually ignored. It should be illegal for these adverts to be hosted by online marketplaces.

attributes.action: UK Government should fund the Bloodhound supersonic car to completion.
attributes.background: Funding in the UK inspired, globally visible project has failed.  As a leading tool to engage STEM topics in UK schools, colleges and universities it has no competitors.  A failure to deliver the programme damages the UKs reputation and impacts vital means to get young people focused on engineering.
attributes.additional_details:
See Bloodhound ambassador work carried out globally.   

Significant public awareness and STEM education that will be negatively impacted.

attributes.action: Make food and drink labelling more specific when stating may contain nuts
attributes.background: So many packaging contains the phrase “may contain nuts”. This needs to be more specific as someone with a peanut allergy may not have an allergy to any other nuts but won’t buy the product because it’s not specific enough even though this particular nut may not be present.
attributes.additional_details: most manufacturers use the term “may contain nuts” for example brands such as Cadbury, Kellogg’s, Peters pies the list goes on. The labelling has been seen on yoghurt, cereals, baked goods and even bread. People with a certain nut allergy should be able to look at the packaging and see what nuts could be present so that they’re not excluded from all nuts that they are able to consume

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to knowingly or recklessly mislead Parliament
attributes.background:
The operation of our democracy requires the electorate to be able to place trust in statements made by the Government and its ministers. 

Deception has no place in public life but is increasingly used as a means to an end.

Our Parliament must not become a post-truth institution.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Provide more support to put an end to modern slavery in Libya
attributes.background: Last year CNN released video footage of Black African migrants being bought and sold in to slavery in Libya. The horrific events happened openly in slave auctions and migrants were being sold for as little as $400. There were also many accounts that women and girls were being sold in to sex slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It has now been almost a year since the release of the slave auction video footage. The media's interest has significantly lessened, and public discussion has waned.

I am therefore asking the UK government to again put pressure on Libya to put an end to modern-day slavery. I am also asking the UK government to provide the public with a full and transparent update on the UK emergency interventions and UK programmes designed to specifically target Black African migrants and refugees in Libya, including a response containing details of further plans to support the complete eradication of modern slavery in the region.

https://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/14/africa/libya-migrant-auctions/index.html

attributes.action: Urge food manufacturers to reduce the amount of added sugar in yoghurt & cereal
attributes.background:
There has been a lot of coverage in the press about the 'sugar drinks tax'. Per 100g some cereals contain just as much sugar, if not more than some of these sugary drinks. 
I want the government to call on food manufacturers to reduce the amount of added sugar in yoghurts and breakfast cereals.
attributes.additional_details:
Some cereals that are aimed at young children have just as much, if not more, added sugar than some sugary drinks. 
 
Coca cola contains 10.6g of sugar per 100ml 
Tesco Multigrain Boulders contain 25g sugar per 100g 
Crunchy Nut clusters contain 31g sugar per 100g 
Frosties contain 37g sugar per 100g
 
A decent breakfast is vital for children going into school.
 
I believe that cereals should have a reduced amount of added sugar in order to help tackle the UKs obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: To reform the PIP assessment process for people affected by mental illness
attributes.background:
The PIP assessment process is inadequate & aimed primarily at people with physical illness.

There should be two forms one for physical illness & one for mental illness 

All assessors & DWP decision-makers to be appropriately trained in mental health to understand the impact on the assessed.
attributes.additional_details:
I run an art group for all those severely affected by mental illness. I watch many members of my group experience all sorts of anxieties before, during and after their PIP assessments. 
I have developed the following solutions in consultation with the charity Rethink Mental Illness.
Time and time again, my group members and thousands of others, wait for long periods before receiving their results, often to be told they have been awarded nil points.

attributes.action: Demand a public inquiry into the serious failings of South Western Railway.
attributes.background:
In March 2017, the DfT awarded the south west railway franchise to First/MTR - South Western Railway, for a minimum term of 7 years.

To date the franchise has delivered:

Relentless delays & cancellations 
Incorrect or no travel info 
Aggressive revenue enforcement 
Onerous claims process
attributes.additional_details:
More details
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/one-in-four-trains-late-each-day-on-troubled-south-western-railway-a3994856.html 
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-6482487/Commuters-hit-delays-cancellations-South-Western-Railway.html 
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/12/09/christmas-rail-passengers-facing-perfect-storm-delays-disruption/ 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-46258720 
https://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/news/17255492.letter-to-the-editor/

attributes.action: Allow Parliament to vote on Brexit deal before Christmas
attributes.background: We believe it is right to allow the Parliament to vote on the final Brexit deal before they break up for Christmas providing a clear view for individuals, businesses and the UK and Europe as a whole. We respectfully request the vote is organised and the results published as a matter of priority.
attributes.additional_details: If the vote doesn't take place until January, that gives Parliament less time to consider other options, including preparations for a no-deal scenario or a general election or public vote on what to do next, etc.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from being included with children's magazines
attributes.background: Publishers are unlikely to stop doing this unless there is some kind of universal agreement for all to stop at a given time in the future.
attributes.additional_details: The magazines are great, educational, and kids love them. The toys are merely to encourage favour of one magazine over another. They are also cheaply made and break quickly.  This is creating a significant amount of pollution (something that our children will not thank us for in years to come).  Adding the toys also takes advantage of children's susceptibility to advertising.

attributes.action: Provide funding for mental health facilities in schools.
attributes.background:
As a young person, I feel it is my duty to break the stigma of mental health. If we can manage this problem right from the root, we can decrease suicide rates and prevent mental illnesses from progressing.
Statistics shows that mental health issues in young people have increased 6X since 1995.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a significant increase in recent years and young people aren't reporting issues such as anxiety or depression. 

We need trained staff and support in schools; there are so many young people that need support but do not know how to speak out. Without services providing adequate support for all young people, there is absolutely no way we will be able to climb out this dark hole we currently find ourselves in.

attributes.action: Stop UK complicity in the Coalition's war on Yemen
attributes.background: The Coalition's aerial campaign has led to thousands of civilian deaths in Yemen, destroyed most of the infrastructure and led to the "world’s worst humanitarian crisis" according to Antonio Guterres.
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure the UK is not complicit in the death and suffering of the Yemeni people, we should:
 
1. Stop, or make all future weapons exports to coalition countries subject to ending of the bombing campaign and rebuilding of destroyed infrastructure.
 
2. Make all activities of any on-the-ground UK experts maintaining weapon systems subject to Whitehall and Westminster scrutiny.
 
The UK should set an example, provide moral leadership and lean on its international partners to follow suit.

attributes.action: Make LGV & PSV drivers pass a UK driving test before working in the UK
attributes.background: Make all non-UK lgv and psv drivers pass a UK driving test before working within UK for more than a month. I drive LGV and passed a UK test many years ago. I know of companies that employ lots of non UK drivers, some have brought a licence without taking a test.
attributes.additional_details: Overseas drivers may not be familiar with UK roads. It could help stop accidents on UK roads if they took the test.

attributes.action: Make all school holidays (primary and secondary) across the UK, the same.
attributes.background: To make the lives of all parents and carers logistically easier and for families to all be able to enjoy school holidays TOGETHER... we need to standardise school holidays so that all UK schools take their holidays at the same time.
attributes.additional_details:
It is not uncommon for parents to have both a primary aged child and a secondary aged child - who’s schools have their half term holidays on different weeks.

Furthermore, teachers who have children of their own, often find themselves receiving a half term holiday at a different time to their own children - who may be at school in a neighbouring town or city for example.

attributes.action: Add tattoos to the protected characteristics under The Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop discrimination towards people with tattoos by signing this petition to add tattoos to the list of protected characteristics. This would mean employers cannot force employees to cover visible tattoos, as long as these aren't deemed offensive language or to any of the 9 existing characteristics.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 3 young adults in the UK have at least 1 tattoo today and this is still growing. Tattoos are part of different cultures throughout the world and are simply part of a person when they have them done. It is offensive and should be illegal for an employer to say to someone to cover their skin because they don’t like someone’s tattoo(s).

attributes.action: Pressure the Chinese government remove the reverse ban on rhinos and tiger trade
attributes.background: The Chinese government has decided to reverse their 25 year ban on the trade of rhinos and tigers.
attributes.additional_details: Only 30,000 rhinos and 3,900 tigers remain in the wild. Their extinction will be accelerated without the ban. there is an old tradition which believes that tiger and rhino bones have medical healing powers which have been proven false.

attributes.action: Intervene in the management of Bishop Auckland General Hospital.
attributes.background: Since Bishop Auckland General Hospital merged in to County Durham & Darlington NHS Trust, services have been lost and ward closures have become the normality. The hospital is now unable to serve the town and area.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must work with NHS Improvement to investigate these failings, and if necessary consider removing the trust’s responsibility for Bishop Auckland General Hospital.

attributes.action: DfE: add a clear definition of Order of Operations to National Curriculum.
attributes.background: Current National Curriculum does not provide information on what Order of Operations should be in maths. Most students and teachers use BODMAS to remember the sequence but, unfortunately, some of them understand the order too literally and therefore are not able to complete simple maths sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of study resources omit ( or do not detail enough) the fact that Division and Multiplication, as well as Addition and Subtraction, are equally ranked and have to be completed left-to-right. Many students, and unfortunately, some teachers, understand the order too literally, calculating Addition before Subtraction getting wrong answers for simple maths sentences. 
We are worried about future of our kids, who will have to pass their exams to get into higher education.

attributes.action: Make Flu Jab Free For All Parents With Infants Under 6 Months
attributes.background: Babies are the most likely to be admitted to hospital with flu, and are not eligible for vaccine until they are 6 months old. In addition pregnancy causes immunosuppression. In order to reduce the number of babies getting flu, their primary caregivers should be eligible for a free NHS flu vaccine.

attributes.action: Make Makaton/BSL part of the national curriculum at Early Years Level.
attributes.background: Communication is an ESSENTIAL life skill. Much of everyday life relies on it, from playing to learning, to getting our needs met. Makaton is a language programme using signs and symbols to aid communication and designed to support the spoken language.
attributes.additional_details: My son is 5 years old, just started year 1 mainstream primary school and has a diagnosis of non verbal autism with learning difficulties. His needs are not deemed enough for an additional needs school yet he is unable to communicate with his peers and teachers. If makaton or BSL were taught in the early years my son would now be able to communicate his needs, communicate with his friends and show his teachers how much he understands of the curriculum he is being taught. Please help us 10,000 signatures is all we need in order to give him a voice!

attributes.action: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.background: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.additional_details:
Right to 28 days to repay prescription charges:

Temporary financial difficulties happen to us all at some point in our lives, and being struck by one can be made worse when you become ill but don't qualify for financial support. I would like to propose that there be made available a 28 day period of grace for all citizens to pay prescription charges after the receipt of items. No one should be left without medical care because of a short term financial crisis. 
So those who desperately need medical help can receive it and re-pay within their next pay period.

attributes.action: Allow England to form a devolved Government.
attributes.background: Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales have freedom to make their own decisions and choices with a devolved democracy. England however has to follow the laws that Westminster agrees. It is not fair that these countries get to vote and have an input on decisions that affect our lives but not their own.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g Scotland can contribute to the decision over the future of our NHS, something of which doesn't not affect themselves.
If we had a devolved democracy, England would have the right to freedom. Let our lives be determined by our own decisions and not because of others; with a devolved democracy this is made possible.

attributes.action: Not pay foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons
attributes.background: If a country possess nuclear weapons it is in no need of British charity. Donating foreign aid to countries that possess nuclear weapons is a slap in the face of British tax payers.

attributes.action: EU nationals paying taxes here, to have a vote in all future GEs and referenda.
attributes.background: There should be no taxation without representation. EU nationals legally resident here for 5 years and paying UK taxes should have a vote in all future GEs and referenda. My Swedish wife, here for 36 years, having brought up 3 children here, working and paying taxes here, still cannot vote in GEs.
attributes.additional_details:
Some 3 million plus EU nationals living and working and paying taxes here in the UK, were denied a voice in the 2016 EU referendum that directly affected them, their families, and their futures here. I believe THAT position is an affront to democracy and makes a mockery of any notion of basic fairness. 

It is an intolerable stain on the reputation of the UK for decency and fairness that this situation exists in 2018.. It must be rectified, and as soon as possible.

attributes.action: More Necessary Research and Funding on the NHS for Ehlers Danlos Patients.
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos syndrome is a condition that affects the connective tissue. Several of the symptoms involve stretchy skin, severe dislocations and unusual bleeding as well as joint pain. Seven years ago I was diagnosed with Eds which is when I realised that research was limited.
attributes.additional_details: As an EDS sufferer for several years, it has become apparent that the lack of research and funding and treatments not being on the NHS is the reason that Ehlers danlos patients are treated unfairly. If we attend Accident and Emergency we should not have to explain to medical professionals what our condition is and the symptoms they should look out for and we should not have to find our own ways of treatment because the NHS lacks sufficient help.

attributes.action: Government: honour your manifesto pledge to plant 11m trees by 2020
attributes.background: You won the election with a promise to plant 11million trees by 2020. You must action this and report bi-annually on progress with measures in place to ensure this is met.
attributes.additional_details: Governments must honour their manifesto pledges. Climate change is upon us and biodiversity loss is unprecedented. This government must be held to account on environmental protection & lack of tangible action on their tree planting pledge. Trees take years to grow, they need a management plan and funds to support their maturation. The Government should deliver their promise on time or provide funding to ensure that a suitable charity can take ownership of this action.

attributes.action: Make an unlawful killing law for killing pets.
attributes.background: Our 'family pet' was killed without justifiable cause. We have received unsatisfactory help from the 'authorities'. I feel a change in the law is needed.
attributes.additional_details: Recently our family pet (dog) was killed by another dog owner who was 'trying to separate' six excited, playing dogs (3 of them his own) with a small branch/large stick laying nearby. He killed our dog Louie with one hit on the head. The R.S.P.C.A. say it wasn't cruelty as Louie died instantly and the police are not pursuing a prosecution. This has caused a lot of distress to the family and a lot of concern locally. A new law or a clearer defining of current laws are urgently needed.

attributes.action: Remove hemp from schedule 1 and reclassify as an agricultural crop.
attributes.background: We are calling for the immediate withdrawal of hemp from Schedule 1 and urgent reclassification as an industrial and agricultural crop. It should not be regulated under the Misuse of Drugs Act at all, let alone put in the most restrictive category alongside dangerous class As.
attributes.additional_details: With Brexit looming, the UK needs to become self-reliant for our sources of food, energy, fuel and raw materials. Hemp is the perfect crop to provide all of these. Hemp seeds are a nutritionally complete food. The plant could replace cotton. It's an abundant source of cellulose so can make paper and plastic. It needs no pesticides, pulls carbon from the atmosphere, prevents soil erosion and absorbs toxins from the soil, helping to prevent climate change, and it only takes 3 months to grow.

attributes.action: Provide domestic violence victims with paid leave to help them escape abusers
attributes.background: An average of 2 women a week are killed in the UK. The majority are killed at home, often at the hands of a partner. One of the most dangerous times for a victim of domestic abuse is when they try to leave. In giving victims help with their economic situation, we could save so many.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside a threat of violence, emotional & financial barriers make leaving an abusive home difficult. Escaping requires meticulous planning and preparation. Someone may need time off work to move without their partner knowing or they may simply not be able to afford to escape. 

If the UK follows the example set by New Zealand and the Philippines, in giving domestic violence victims paid leave to escape their violent household, we could help before it's too late. 

https://www.google.co.nz/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/world/2018/jul/26/new-zealand-paid-domestic-violence-leave-jan-logie

attributes.action: Make politicians in any elections declare if they support Leave or Remain.
attributes.background: In UK elections, voters elect representatives on pledges or party political policies. MP's have broken that trust voting against pledges. We the undersigned petition that: Until further notice, all candidates display 1) Party membership. 2) Their commitment to Remain or Leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Major UK political parties committed to 'Respect the Democratic Leave Referendum Vote in 2016' and were duly returned to parliament by majority in 2017. Since then, we have seen Remain and Leave supporting MP's elected in 'Leave majority seats' vote against previous pledges and even propose obstructions to the process. This has seen party political bickering over the past two years when negotiations and deals should have been the priority. When we vote, we want to know what we are voting for.

attributes.action: Carers must be included in the key worker scheme
attributes.background: Carers are largest source of care in the UK and should be included in the key workers living scheme. Despite the govt attempts this scheme does not extend far beyond. The fact is that what constitute the term key workers is narrow and the individuals that fall outside this definition are left out.
attributes.additional_details: The importance of affordable housing for carers has not received the attention. It is essential that carers live in all parts of our communities to provide invaluable service to the UK population which is currently experiencing a high number of old people requiring the services of the carers. Financial challenges due to Poor wages, high cost of accommodation especially in more affluent areas makes it difficult to attract and retain carers. I suggest the carers are included to the key worker scheme to support them and ensure that they provide safe and excellent services, and also make them appreciated by their govt

attributes.action: Vote on England & Wales to Leave the UK & EU.  Scotland & NI to Remain in both.
attributes.background:
If England and Wales leave the UK political union Scotland and Northern Ireland should be able to retain their membership as the remaining UK entity.  

The vote must take place as soon as possible in order to allow provision for Scotland and Northern Ireland to remain in the EU before Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
As per European Court of Justice ruling Article 50 could be unilaterally revoked by the remainder of the UK, Scotland and Northern Ireland, who would be the Continuing Member State.

England and Wales would be free to deliver Brexit without the need for a backstop arrangement.

attributes.action: Stop tax on vet bills
attributes.background: A recent visit to the vets saw my dog have to undergo emergency surgery at the cost, all told, of just over £1200.00. When paying the bill I was appalled to see nearly £180.00 in tax!! Being taxed on your pets welfare is extremely wrong in my eyes.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student and a carer and survive on a small income. Although I was insured, due to the health background history of the pet, they would not pay. I was fortunate enough to have family who helped me out, but I wonder how many other people find themselves struggling to pay such huge vet bills only to find tax is also added. What is the cost to our pets?

attributes.action: Amend s.76 Serious Crime Act 2015 (Parental Alienation amendment)
attributes.background: Parental Alienation is a psychological crime against former partners and children, yet is largely ignored by the Police and Courts. Amend s.76 SCA 2015 to specifically make Parental Alienation a "domestic Abuse" crime. This is child abuse as well as parent abuse and it must stop.
attributes.additional_details: The Courts, CAFCASS, Social Services and the Police treat domestic violence as a crime against women, yet up to 1200 men take their lives each year because the system blocks them from their children. Whilst this may seem like a crime against an adult, it is actually child abuse. Reports in numerous countries demonstrate how damaging this is to children and yet the UK Government ignores the issue. One suicide is too many, but over 1000 annually is a national disgrace.

attributes.action: Prostate cancer screening tests for men ages 18+
attributes.background:
Men tend to be less likely to check themselves than women.

A screening is less scary and embarrassing for men than visiting their GP.

Women have the tools and aid put in place to help them however men don't... why is that ?
attributes.additional_details:
Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men.

Every 45 minutes one man dies from prostate cancer – that's more than 11,000 men every year

In the UK, about 1 in 8 men will get prostate cancer at some point in their lives.

attributes.action: Introduce tougher penalties for commercial fly-tipping
attributes.background:
Millions of pounds of taxpayer's money is spent clearing up behind these unscrupulous criminals, the current legislation does not appear to be an effective deterrent.

The cost of clearance to local authorities in England in 2017/18 was £12.2 million, for large fly-tipping incidents.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Parliament to debate the illegal industrial sized fly-tipping that blights our nation. Specifically, the petition calls for Parliament to debate: 

(i)   Whether the relevant enforcement agencies are adequately resourced to enforce existing legislation?
(ii)  Whether current legislation is being implemented robustly by Her Majesty's Court Service?
(iii) Whether Parliament needs to consider passing new legislation to provide an effective deterrent?

attributes.action:
Introduce a code on the 'School attendance
Guidance' for chronic illness.
attributes.background: Currently, parents of children who are chronically ill face pressure for their child to improve attendance.  This situation is mainly caused by the absence reporting done as part of inspection.  A code for this type of absence could be reported separately and not impact schools' attendance figures.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of chronically ill children are one of society's most vulnerable groups - they are tired, worried and stressed.  Some have even lost jobs due to their child's health.  

As schools have become more strident in maintaining high attendance levels, pressure to attend has become, in some instances, inhumane.  The current system is not in the best interests of children, of parents or of schools.

A specific code that schools use for chronic health conditions would help to alleviate this issue.
